title: Emergency Brexit summit could be held if Emmanuel Macron opposes extension
text:
EU leaders could be forced to hold the emergency Brexit summit none of them wanted, if reports that President Emmanuel Macron is opposing Donald Tusk's recommendation that Brexit be delayed for three months are proved correct.

The president of the European Council has said that the extension could be granted by written procedure, avoiding an EU summit in Brussels. But diplomatic sources told the Telegraph that would only be possible if all EU27 leaders agreed on the length of the extension.
